title: Nasus and his Gameplay Pattern
body:
Maybe some in Riot can elaborate, but with their current design philosophy, why is Nasus allowed to keep a gameplay pattern that encourages him to not interact with his team or opponents? 

His basic pattern encourages him to ignore his opponent through lane phase with is about 15-20mins of the game, then encourages him to continue farming, which means he doesn't assist the team through midgame skirmishes. 

Now, I understand that there are some Nasus players that run teleport and do show up for things, but I think we can admit that the greater number do not. What is Riot's opinion on this and what can be done to encourage Nasus to leave his lane and help or to actively fight his opponent?

He's dreadfully boring to fight, what can be done to change that without ruining his core character?

replies.body:
It's a player perception issue and probably the hardest thing to understand about Nasus (or any top laner). 

* It's okay to sacrifice stacks/farm to help your team (personal judgment is important).
* If someone else on your team is fed, you don't need a ton of stacks/farm to be useful.
* Top laners are not always expected to carry games.

With lane swaps not being a thing in SoloQ, Nasus shouldn't be seen or played any differently than any other split push oriented top laners.
Op's point isn't that he has a problem with a champion staying top. His point is that he has a problem with a champion that plays solitaire and doesn't give his opponent a window to "beat" him.

Nasus has plenty of a window to beat him. His early game is extremely weak. He has no ability to reliably poke. His Q is very weak early. He can't spam E or he will OOM **very** quickly and won't be able to Q stack. Champions like GP, Riven, Panth, Darius, Olaf, Teemo, Trundle, Rumble, Lissandra or Ryze can harass/out-trade him out of lane very easily. A lot of mistakes players make is that they also shove their wave while harassing him and give him free farm under tower. This also leaves them vulnerable for ganks. Stand at the front of your minion wave and harass him whenever he goes in for a Q stack. He can't out trade you early, especially when he is trying to use his main damage ability on minions all the time. Yes, there will be a point where you may not be able to duel him anymore, but he is sacrificing early game strength for late game power.

He can't out trade you early, especially when he is trying to use his main damage ability on minions all the time. Yes, there will be a point where you may not be able to duel him anymore, but he is sacrificing early game strength for late game power.

*Unlimited* late game power. It doesn't matter how well you do against a Nasus in lane. He will eventually get to the point where he's tanky as hell (because literally every item he has built is a tank item save for trinity force) yet he does more damage than anybody on your team. Nobody can 1v1 him at that point, and few teams even have the tools to 2v1 him without him *still* getting a kill, simply because of how tanky he is. Other champions have to build damage to do damage, and when they don't, people complain that they're broken. He is capable of doing insane amounts of damage to towers while barely taking any himself - he's a champion that requires so many of your team's resources to deal with, that the rest of Nasus's team can do whatever they please in the meantime. Other pushers and burst-melees can be killed, other tanks can be kited, Nasus gets the best of both worlds.

They should make his Q work like Thresh's souls - infinite stacking, but diminishing returns, with an ideal threshold (no pun intended) for his stacks at a certain point in the game. There is no reason why a champion who builds no damage should have the same DPS as someone who did - otherwise, what is even the point?

I don't want Nasus to be gutted and unplayable. I want him to be fair. Every champion in a competitive PvP game should be fair.

Unlimited power if the game goes past 50 minutes. If Nasus wants to do nothing but farm top lane early, then use that to take the rest of the map. Or pick any of the dozen of champions that crushes him early. Using your logic, Veigar is OP because he also has unlimited late game power....

There is a reason Veigar was just nerfed. I believe full-heartedly that Veigar was OP, and I still believe that infinite stacking is OP - it's only acceptable on Thresh because he doesn't get armor per level, and acceptable on Sion because of his low base health. Their infinite stackings come with compromises in the rest of their kit.

You have to answer Nasus. He doesn't need to farm for 50 minutes to be a threat. If he stays top and goes Tryndamere mode, he can easily take your towers and inhibitors by himself. If he decides to join the teamfights, he can absorb all the damage you can ask of a tank - and you have to answer it, because otherwise he'll stroll straight to your backline and 1 or 2-shot one of your carries. *Again*, carries that spent the whole game building damage, because that's what is expected of them. Nasus, who built none, outdamages them. Just like Tryndamere, he is incredibly good at pushing because almost nobody can 1v1 him - and if you send more than one person to stop him from taking your base, that leaves the rest of his team at an advantage.

It's not hard to completely avoid the enemy team and farm all game as Nasus, and then come out of the fog of war and stomp all over your team like Godzilla. You CAN fight people early and mid-game as Nasus, and if you're having a problem against your lane as Nasus, all you need to do is call your jungle to babysit - he doesn't even have to get a kill out of it, because as has been pointed out multiple times, Nasus doesn't *have* to interact with the enemy team at all to get fed. He is a PvE champion in a PvP game. That just isn't fair.

Now, if you accept the premise that he needs more interactivity, what if using Siphoning Strike on champions gave him 2 stacks (instead of 3 for a minion kill). It would encourage Nasus to fight the enemy top laner. He'd require a nerf elsewhere, maybe a reduction in his passive lifesteal? If you want to make his passive more interesting, you could reduce his lifesteal against minions.

Nasus is not punished for building all tank. He is a tank who gets an entire build's DPS for free, all on one ability with an incredibly short cooldown.

Let's pretend that Nasus's Q didn't stack upon minion kills, and only had its base damage to go off of. At max rank, it is adding 110 damage to his total AD. Compare this to Jax, who actually has to build damage to do damage. Nasus's Siphoning Strike has a four second cooldown to Empower's three seconds. Assuming that Jax has a trinity force, his W is only doing 88 more damage than Nasus's Q. Jax is a champion who is rewarded for jumping into dangerous situations, his E and ult are there to keep him alive because his build prioritizes damage before tank stats. Even with this additional survivability, Jax can be outplayed, and he can be killed. It is within the realm of possibility to 2v1 a late-game Jax without somebody dying. Nasus's Q with zero stacks is doing a fairly close amount of damage to Jax's E, and this is on a tank. 

Now let's add back all those stacks we conveniently forgot about. Assume Nasus has 400 stacks, and now his Q (with basically the same cooldown as Jax's E) is doing 312 more damage than Empower. Assume it's 600 stacks, and that Nasus has a Trinity Force. With 119 base AD, Nasus just hit you for 987 damage, before armor reduction. This is on a champion who has built basically nothing but health and resistances, whose build path conveniently allows him to build CDR as well. This champion will only become more and more of a problem as the game goes on. You can't stop him from farming, because he can and will just ignore you as OP pointed out.

Nasus gets an entire build's worth of damage for free, on a single ability with a ridiculously short cooldown (2.4 seconds with 40% CDR). He still gets the same amount of gold for farming as everyone else does, he's just given twice the reward. Everyone in the game needs gold, Nasus does nothing special to get the benefits he gets. He is a great tank, thanks to his instant 600 HP boost and a stronger version of exhaust (with a 1.6 second down time with 40% cdr, coincidentally making him impossible to escape). He can also one-shot your carries just as effectively as a LeBlanc, who has half his health and a third of his armor/MR.

This champion simply gets way too much for free. This is a problem that all of the most broken champions have (*cough* Riven *cough*) and needs to be addressed. The only reason Nasus isn't played competitively is because it takes LCS-level coordination to prevent him from single-handedly winning the game, something that's quite conveniently present in LCS games and absent from solo-queue.

EDIT: Unless you're Rumble... but Rumble is Rumble.
EDIT 2: Let's not forget his passive, as well. A flat life-steal bonus, giving him the equivalent of a free vampiric scepter, which becomes two free vampiric scepters later on. Even more free stats that make a champion designed to sit and farm all game have an even easier time doing so.
His ult is completely automatic reward as well. If Jax's ult is meant to keep him alive, Nasus' does it better as well. A giant pile of HP and and AoE shred.
